workflow.name: Generate empathetic customer replies with Claude AI and auto-escalation
workflow.description:
## üß† Overview
Generate empathetic, professional reply drafts for customer or user messages.  
The workflow detects **sentiment**, **tone**, and **risk level**, drafts a concise response, sanitizes PII/links/emojis, and **auto-escalates** risky or low-confidence cases to human review.

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How It Works
1. **Input** ‚Äî Manual Test or Webhook Trigger  
2. **AI Agent (Empathy)** ‚Äî returns `{ sentiment, tone, reply, confidence, needs_handover }`  
3. **Post-Process & Sanitize** ‚Äî removes URLs/hashtags, masks PII, caps length  
4. **Risk & Handover Rules** ‚Äî checks confidence threshold, risk words, and negativity  
5. **Routing** ‚Äî auto-send safe replies or flag to **Needs Review**

---

## üß© Setup Instructions (3‚Äì5 min)
- Open **Set Config1** and adjust:
  - `MAX_LEN` (default 600)
  - `ADD_FOLLOWUP_QUESTION` (true/false)
  - `FORMALITY` (`auto | casual | polite`)
  - `EMOJI_ALLOWED` (true/false), `BLOCK_LINKS` (true/false)
  - `RISK_WORDS` (e.g., `refund, lawsuit, self-harm`)
- Connect **Anthropic credential** to **Anthropic Chat Model**
- *(Optional)* Replace **Manual Trigger** with **Webhook Trigger** for real-time use

> Tip: If you need to show literal angle brackets in messages, use backticks like ``<example>`` (no HTML entities needed).

---

## üìö Use Cases
### 1) SaaS Billing Complaints
- **Input:** ‚ÄúI was billed after canceling. This is unacceptable.‚Äù  
- **Output:** Calm, apologetic reply with refund steps; escalates if `refund` is in `RISK_WORDS` or `confidence < 0.45`.

### 2) Product Bug Reports
- **Input:** ‚ÄúUpload fails on large files since yesterday.‚Äù  
- **Output:** Acknowledges impact, requests logs, offers workaround; routes to auto-send if low risk and high confidence.

### 3) Delivery/Logistics Delays
- **Input:** ‚ÄúMy order is late again. Should I file a complaint?‚Äù  
- **Output:** Empathetic apology, ETA guidance, partial credit policy note; escalates if language indicates legal action.

### 4) Community Moderation / Abuse
- **Input:** ‚ÄúSupport is useless‚Äîyou‚Äôre all scammers.‚Äù  
- **Output:** De-escalating, policy-aligned response; auto-flags due to negative sentiment + risk keyword match.

### 5) Safety / Self-harm Mentions
- **Input:** ‚ÄúI feel like hurting myself if this isn‚Äôt fixed.‚Äù  
- **Output:** **Immediate escalation**, inserts approved resources; never auto-sends.

---

## üö® Auto-Escalation Rules (defaults)
- **Negative** sentiment
- Message matches any `RISK_WORDS`
- `confidence < 0.45`
- Mentions of **legal**, **harassment**, or **self-harm** context

---

## üß™ Notes & Best Practices
- üîê No hardcoded API keys ‚Äî use **n8n Credentials**
- üß≠ Tune thresholds and `RISK_WORDS` to your org policy
- üß© Works on self-hosted or cloud n8n
- ‚úÖ Treat outputs as **drafts**; ship after human/policy review

---

## üîó Resources
- **GitHub (template JSON):** https://github.com/yskmtb0714/n8n-workflows/blob/main/empathy-reply-assistant.json

parameters.text:
=You are an Empathy Reply Assistant for English-language messages.
Analyze the incoming text:
<Text>{{ $json.text || $json.message || $json.input || JSON.stringify($json) }}</Text>

Goals:
1) Detect `sentiment` (positive|neutral|negative|mixed)
2) Choose a natural human `tone` that fits the sender (warm, calm, upbeat, apologetic, confident, concise)
3) Draft a short `reply` (<= {{ $('Set Config1').item.json.MAX_LEN }} chars) that:
   - acknowledges the emotion first in plain English
   - provides a practical next step or clarification
   - {{ $('Set Config1').item.json.ADD_FOLLOWUP_QUESTION ? 'ends with a gentle question' : 'may end without a question' }}
   - uses **no links**, **no hashtags**
   - matches formality: {{ $('Set Config1').item.json.FORMALITY }} (auto|casual|polite)

Return **JSON only** with keys: sentiment, tone, reply, confidence (0.0‚Äì1.0), needs_handover (boolean).

options.systemMessage: Role: Empathetic, practical, concise. Avoid corporate cliches. Keep it in English. No URLs or hashtags.

assignments.name: note
assignments.value: Escalate to human: risk/low-confidence/negative tone detected.

parameters.content:
## Empathy Reply Assistant
**What it does**  
Generates empathetic reply drafts, sanitizes content, and auto-escalates risky cases.

**Flow**  
1) Input (Manual / Webhook)  
2) AI (Claude) ‚Üí { sentiment, tone, reply, confidence }  
3) Sanitize (links / PII / length)  
4) Risk rules (keywords, negativity, low confidence)  
5) Route ‚Üí **OK** / **Needs Review**

**Who for**  
Support, Community, Sales, CX, Automation builders

## Routes & Thresholds
**Escalate (Needs Review)** when:  
- negative sentiment  
- matches `RISK_WORDS`  
- confidence < 0.45  
- mentions legal / harassment / self-harm  

**Auto-OK** when:  
- no risk matched  
- confidence ‚â• 0.45  

**Outputs**  
- OK ‚Üí sendable draft  
- REVIEW ‚Üí human check required

## Setup (3‚Äì5 min)
1. Connect **Anthropic** ‚Üí Anthropic Chat Model  
2. Edit **Set Config1**:  
   - `MAX_LEN`, `FORMALITY`, `ADD_FOLLOWUP_QUESTION`  
   - `EMOJI_ALLOWED`, `BLOCK_LINKS`  
   - `RISK_WORDS` (add your terms)  
3. Choose trigger:  
   - **Manual** ‚Üí testing  
   - **Webhook** ‚Üí real-time replies  
   - **Schedule** ‚Üí every 5‚Äì10 min  

üí° Tip: keep secrets in **Credentials**, not nodes.

## Notes / Safety
- üîê No hardcoded API keys ‚Üí use **Credentials**  
- üß™ Treat outputs as **drafts** before sending  
- üßπ Remove test data before sharing publicly  
- ‚öôÔ∏è Tune thresholds & `RISK_WORDS` to your org policy  
- üóÇÔ∏è Optionally log to Slack / Sheets for review  

Author: **Yusuke (@yskautomation)**  
License: **MIT**

user.name: Yusuke

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
